main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over McKinney, Texas on April 4, 1956, by local weather bureau observer and an amateur astronomer.
interesting points: One observer thought the UFO was a weather balloon but later confirmed there were no balloons in the area,The object maintained a fixed position relative to Venus, leading to speculation about its movement,The UFO emitted a silvery glow and appeared to be about 100,000 feet high,The raised band around the middle of the UFO remained stationary throughout the observation,Two subsequent sightings reported additional glowing objects in the area after the initial sighting.
sighted object: unidentified flying object that resembled a balloon
witness description: one amateur astronomer and one weather observer at a local weather station
